result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy Alexander Barbosa

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremy Alexander Barbosa appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Jeremy Alexander Barbosa.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for plea and sentencing. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy Alexander Barbosa in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Discussion held off the record. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request a resolution hearing date.
Parties advised: Effective July 30, 2022 this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15 in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 6/4/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jeremy Alexander Barbosa in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/02/2022@1p
